Congress approved: 1.6 billion for replacing existing barriers and adding new fencing, which are not concrete and do not resemble Trump's wall prototypes.
The omnibus spending bill for fiscal yea: which Trump claims is funding the construction of the wall.
Customs and Border Protection Acting Dep: Vitiello stated that the spending bill will fund about 100 miles of "border wall system," but it does not fully meet the needs in critical locations.
The construction includes replacing old: dilapidated landing mats with steel bollard walls, replacing secondary barriers, and building new border walls in specific areas such as Calexico, California, and Santa Teresa, New Mexico.
